wikipedia_page.main: Matthew Robert Ingram (born 18 December 1993) is an English professional footballer who plays as a goalkeeper for EFL Championship club Hull City. He has previously played for Wycombe Wanderers, Lewes, Hayes & Yeading United, Oxford City, Northampton Town and Queens Park Rangers.

response: *Matt Ingram – footballer with Hull City, formerly with Wycombe Wanderers.
* Matt Ingram, goalkeeper at Hull City, formerly at Wycombe Wanderers

Smithies was initially the backup goalkeeper to Rob Green. Due to a clause in his contract, Green did not play from 1 January 2016 to the end of the season. Smithies and Matt Ingram vied for the number 1 spot. He played 18 Championship matches that season.

Parish joined Wycombe Wanderers in an emergency loan deal on 18 September 2012 after injuries to regular goalkeepers Nikki Bull and Matt Ingram. He made his debut for the club the same day in a 3–2 defeat away to Exeter City. He made just one further appearance for the club, a 1–0 home defeat by AFC Wimbledon four days later.
*2017 – Ghost by Lewis & Leigh (produced by Matt Ingram)

On 8 January 2018 he moved to League One side Blackpool on loan until the end of the season, but was recalled by QPR on 26 April 2018 following an injury to team-mate Matt Ingram. He made is Blackpool debut in a 0-0 draw against Bristol Rovers. Lumley kept a total of nine clean sheets during his time at the Tangerines.

On 2 May 2015, Lynch made his professional debut as a substitute for the injured Matt Ingram in a 3–2 win against Northampton Town. Lynch continued to deputise for Ingram as Wycombe progressed from their League Two playoff semi–final against Plymouth Argyle to the 2015 League Two playoff final.
On 9 January 2016, Lynch featured in Wycombe's 1–1 draw against Aston Villa in the FA Cup 3rd round due to the suspension of Matt Ingram.
